title: Jaylen Brown helps Celtics win Luka Doncic leads Lakers victory
snippets: Forward Jaylen Brown scored 30 points, including three for four shooting from beyond the three-point line, to help the Boston Celtics avert a wild comeback attempt from the Toronto Raptors in a 121-113 win on Sunday.
Jaylen Brown and Derrick White led the way for the Boston Celtics, combining for 57 points to help get them past the Toronto Raptors 121-113.
Luka Doncic dropped a 31-point triple-double and LeBron James poured in 29 points of his own as the Los Angeles Lakers defeated the Philadelphia 76ers 112-108.
Nikola Jokic had a near triple double with 28 points, nine rebounds and 11 assists while shooting 11-of-16 from the field as the Denver Nuggets beat the Charlotte Hornets 115-106.
Chet Holmgren and Jalen Williams dropped 25 points apiece, Aaron Wiggins added 19 points off the bench, and the Oklahoma City Thunder took a 131-101 win over the Utah Jazz.

Jalen Brunson scored a game-high 30 points to go along with nine rebounds, with Josh Hart posting a double-double with 17 points and 12 rebounds to lead the New York Knicks to a 106-100 win over the Orlando Magic.

Brandin Podziemski was brilliant off the bench, scoring a game-high 21 points while adding eight rebounds and seven assists as the Golden State Warriors make light work of the Chicago Bulls, winning 123-91.
The Memphis Grizzlies got 69 points from their bench, including a game-high 22 points from Santi Aldama as the Grizzlies got past the Portland Trail Blazers 119-96.
